Organs/Tissues: Any organ system (BBB, gut, liver, kidney, lung, tumor, etc.) – hardware-agnostic approach
Physiological/Pathological: Both. Normal physiology (shear, co-culture) or disease states (inflammation, infection, cancer, etc.)
Cell Source: All: cell lines, primary cells, iPSC-derived cells, patient tissue, organoids. The user seeds the chosen chip
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, multi-compartment chips with co-cultures. OB1 precisely handles each side’s flow
Stromal Cells: Yes (fibroblasts, pericytes, etc.) in 3D or 2D compartments
Tissue-resident Immune: Yes, included in the tissue or stroma (e.g. microglia in brain, Kupffer cells in liver)
Circulating Immune: Yes, flow immune cells through an endothelial channel for extravasation or infiltration studies
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, multi-organ link or multi-chamber chips in series for body-on-chip applications
Air-Liquid Interface: Supported if the chip design includes an ALI (e.g. lung-on-chip). OB1 can supply vacuum for membrane stretch if needed
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, from 2D coatings to 3D hydrogels. OB1’s gentle flow preserves ECM structures
3D Scaffold: Yes (spheroids, organoids, tissue slices). Perfused by OB1-driven flow lines or recirculation loops
Notable Features: Fast, stable pressure-driven flow. Dynamic flow control (oscillations, pulses). Valves for automated media switching. Low pulsation
Plate/Format (Throughput): Chips are slide-based or custom. Typically low–medium throughput (1–4 chips in parallel). Possibly scaled up with multiple OB1 units
Max Culture Duration: Days–weeks with continuous perfusion, recirculation, stable environment
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, chips made of transparent materials. Stage-compatible. Real-time imaging feasible
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, from outflow or recirculation reservoir. Automated or manual. Low dead volume
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible with trypsin flush or in situ lysis. Typically smaller yield, in-chip analysis is common
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Often in situ. Could destructively open or if chip is custom. 3D constructs might be pipetted out if feasible
Readouts - TEER: No integrated electrodes. Feasible with external instrumentation or custom chip design
Readouts - MEA: Not built-in. Could integrate if user has an MEA-based chip. OB1 handles fluidic part
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: Not by default. They can custom-fabricate chips with sensors. Typically external sampling or optical dyes
Dead Volume: Minimal. Short microfluidic lines. OB1 pressure control ensures rapid switching, small volumes
Perfused: Core. Continuous or intermittent flow. Programmable pressure profiles, recirculation loops
Gas Mix Controlled: Via incubator or external approach. OB1 outside, lines inside. No dedicated O₂/CO₂ module
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes. Dynamic scripts, multi-inlet flow, automated drug pulses, gradient generation
model_availability: Hardware & service from Elvesys. Chips from partners or custom-made. User supplies cells

Organs/Tissues: User-defined. Elvesys can design custom chips for any tissue, from single organ to multi-organ MPS
Physiological/Pathological: Both. They tailor designs for disease states (infection chips, tumor microenvironment) or normal organ function
Cell Source: User’s choice: lines, primaries, iPSC, organoids. Elvesys can incorporate desired geometry for each cell type
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, multi-compartment or layered designs to accommodate co-cultures, immune compartments, etc.
Stromal Cells: Yes, can embed fibroblasts or pericytes in 3D matrix compartments if needed
Tissue-resident Immune: Yes, chip can have compartments for resident immune cells. E.g. microglia in neural chip
Circulating Immune: Yes, design a vascular channel for perfusing immune cells. Precisely controlled by OB1
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, fully customizable. They can link multiple organ compartments in one chip for body-on-chip
Air-Liquid Interface: Possible if user requests a design with open or semipermeable compartments for lung/skin ALI
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, can incorporate membranes, 3D gels, porous scaffolds. Elvesys microfabrication can embed or allow user to add ECM
3D Scaffold: Yes, custom chamber sizes and shapes for organoids or tissue slices. Perfusable networks
Notable Features: End-to-end solution: Elvesys engineers a chip specifically for the user’s organ model, integrates with OB1 flow
Plate/Format (Throughput): Customizable. Could be a single large chamber or multi-unit array. Typically low–medium throughput. Possibly scaled up
Max Culture Duration: Days–weeks. They can incorporate recirculation or large reservoirs for long-term culture
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, typically designed for optical transparency. Could also design optical windows or sensor spots if needed
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, custom ports can be included for sampling or fraction collection
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, can add openable covers or re-sealable compartments if user wants easy retrieval
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Possible. E.g. a removable scaffold or insert for 3D tissue. Elvesys can build a clamp-based design
Readouts - TEER: If requested, they embed electrodes or design for external TEER measurement
Readouts - MEA: If requested, can integrate electrode arrays. Not standard. Each design is user-driven
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: Custom design can incorporate optical or electrochemical sensors. Not out-of-box but feasible
Dead Volume: They minimize it by design. Possibly extremely low with short channels and integrated connectors
Perfused: Yes. OB1-based or other Elvesys pumps. Any flow profile desired. Incorporation of vacuum lines if needed
Gas Mix Controlled: Can design for O₂/CO₂ control if user needs. Typically still uses incubator or external means
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Fully flexible. They can add valve networks for multi-inlet flows, automated protocols, etc.
model_availability: Service-based approach. Elvesys designs & fabricates the chip per user specs, user does the biology
